cab.content: CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Thursday, August 20, 1942, at 6 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P., Deputy Prime Minister (in the Chair)The Right Hon. Sir Stafford CrippsK.C., M.P., Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Secretary of state affairs.for foreign the Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Viscount Halifax,His Majesty's Ambassador to theUnited States of America.The following were also present:The Right Hon. S. M. Bruce,Accredited Representative of theGovernment of the Commonwealthof Australia.The Right Hon. L. S. Amery, M.P.,Secretary of State for India and secretary of State for Burma.Admiral of the Fleet Sir dudley pound, First Sea Lord and Chief ofNaval Staff.Lieut.-General A. E. Nye, Chief of theImperial General Staff.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.Air Chief Marshal Sir Charles F. A.Portal, Chief of the Air Staff.Vice-Admiral Lord Louis Mount-batten, Chief of Combined Opera-tions (Item 1).Secretariat.Sir Edward Bridges,Major-General Sir Hastings Ismay.Brigadier Hollis.Wing Commander Jefferson.minute no.1Contents.Subject.2Combined Operations ....Raid on Dieppe District.Russia .... .... ....Air assistance.Page238238[24252-2]Printed for the-War Cabinet. August 1942.SECRET. Copy NoiW.M. (42)115th Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 115 (42). Russia. 2. The War Cabinet had before them four telegrams, togetherAir Assistance, with a draft telegram circulated at the meeting.The War cabinet invited the Secretary to prepare, in the light of thediscussion (which is recorded in the Secretary's standard file of War Cabinet Conclusions), a revised draft telegram, for submission to the Deputy Prime Ministerprior to despatch.Great George Street, S.W. 1.August 20, 1942.Combined 1. The War Cabinet were given an account, by the Chief of operations. Combined Operations, of the raid on the Dieppe district carriedEaid on Dieppe out on the preceding day. 1 X-\ jDistrict. The main points in the discussion which followed are recorded in the Secretary's Standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions, 7
